## Field Sites
This web-app shows the sites where we operate Eddy Covariance towers and Flux Chamber sites in wetlands across southern Quebec.

Click the points to sites to see more information.

### Lac Saint-Pierre disturbed marsh (UQAM1)
:::: {layout-nrow=1}

:::{.column width="65%"}

* A flux tower was installed in summer 2024
* Get an impression of the site conditions in near real-time on the <a href="https://phenocam.nau.edu/webcam/sites/lspdisturbedmarsh/">Phenocam Network website</a>
* Data download for <a href="https://ameriflux.lbl.gov/sites/siteinfo/CA-CQ1">CA-CQ1</a> will be available in the future through Ameriflux

::: 

::: {.column width="35%"}

![](./images/site-images/uqam1-tower.jpg){fig-align="right" width=35%}

:::

### Lac Saint-Pierre restored marsh (MCGILL1)
:::: {layout-nrow=1}

:::{.column width="65%"}

* A flux tower was installed in spring 2025 and became operational in early summer 2025
* Data download for this flux tower will be available in the future through Ameriflux

::: 

::: {.column width="35%"}

![](./images/site-images/mcgill1-tower.jpg){fig-align="right" width=35%}

:::

::::

### Lac-à-la-Tortue natural open bog (UQAM2)
:::: {layout-nrow=1}

:::{.column width="65%"}

* A flux tower was installed in spring 2025
* The flux tower was struck by lightning briefly after the installation
  - flux instruments were re-installed in July 2025 and the tower became fully operational again
  - biomet sensors were working throughout
* Get an impression of the site conditions in near real-time on the <a href="https://phenocam.nau.edu/webcam/sites/latnaturalopenbog/">Phenocam Network website</a>
* Data download for this flux tower will be available in the future through Ameriflux

::: 

::: {.column width="35%"}

![](./images/site-images/uqam2-tower.jpg){fig-align="right" width=35%}

:::

::::
